scenario: I just graduated from college and I'm not sure what career path to pursue. What do you suggest?
options: Suggest that the user explores different industries and job roles to find their interests
Suggest that the user gives up on finding a career and settles for any job
Suggest that the user asks their parents to choose a career for them
Suggest that the user stays unemployed and does nothing
Suggest that the user takes a random job without considering their interests
adapt_outcome: The user has already explored different industries and job roles to find their interests.

scenario: I have an interview tomorrow. What should I do to prepare?
options: Suggest that the user researches the company and prepares answers to common interview questions
Suggest that the user cancels the interview and avoids the stress
Suggest that the user goes to the interview without any preparation
Suggest that the user asks the interviewer personal questions
Suggest that the user lies about their qualifications
adapt_outcome: The user has already researched the company and prepared answers to common interview questions.

scenario: I want to improve my skills for better job opportunities. What do you recommend?
options: Suggest that the user takes online courses or attends workshops related to their field
Suggest that the user stops trying to improve their skills and settles for their current job
Suggest that the user quits their job and becomes a freelancer
Suggest that the user ignores skill development and focuses on networking only
Suggest that the user copies someone else's work to showcase their skills
adapt_outcome: The user has already taken online courses and attended workshops related to their field.

scenario: I'm not satisfied with my current job. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user explores other job opportunities and considers a career change
Suggest that the user stays in their current job and accepts their dissatisfaction
Suggest that the user quits their job without having another job lined up
Suggest that the user complains about their job to their colleagues
Suggest that the user sabotages their own work to get fired
adapt_outcome: The user has already explored other job opportunities and considered a career change.

scenario: I'm having trouble writing my resume. What advice can you give me?
options: Suggest that the user highlights their relevant skills and experiences on their resume
Suggest that the user submits a blank resume and hopes for the best
Suggest that the user copies a resume template from the internet without any customization
Suggest that the user includes false information on their resume to appear more qualified
Suggest that the user doesn't include any contact information on their resume
adapt_outcome: The user has already highlighted their relevant skills and experiences on their resume.

scenario: I want to negotiate my salary for a new job offer. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user researches the average salary for similar positions and prepares a negotiation strategy
Suggest that the user accepts the job offer without negotiating
Suggest that the user demands an extremely high salary without considering market rates
Suggest that the user asks for a lower salary than what they actually want
Suggest that the user threatens to quit if they don't get the desired salary
adapt_outcome: The user has already researched the average salary for similar positions and prepared a negotiation strategy.

scenario: I'm feeling overwhelmed with job applications. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user breaks down the job application process into smaller tasks and sets achievable goals
Suggest that the user gives up on job applications and remains unemployed
Suggest that the user applies to every job they come across without considering their qualifications
Suggest that the user asks their friends to apply for jobs on their behalf
Suggest that the user submits incomplete or poorly written job applications
adapt_outcome: The user has already broken down the job application process into smaller tasks and set achievable goals.

scenario: I'm considering starting my own business. What advice can you give me?
options: Suggest that the user conducts market research and creates a detailed business plan
Suggest that the user gives up on the idea of starting a business
Suggest that the user starts a business without any planning or research
Suggest that the user invests all their savings into the business without considering the risks
Suggest that the user copies someone else's business idea
adapt_outcome: The user has already conducted market research and created a detailed business plan.

scenario: I'm not getting any responses to my job applications. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user reviews and improves their resume and cover letter
Suggest that the user stops applying for jobs and gives up on finding employment
Suggest that the user applies to random jobs without tailoring their application materials
Suggest that the user blames the companies for not recognizing their talent
Suggest that the user lies about their qualifications on job applications
adapt_outcome: The user has already reviewed and improved their resume and cover letter.

scenario: I'm not happy with my current work-life balance. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user sets boundaries and prioritizes their personal time outside of work
Suggest that the user continues with their current work-life balance and accepts their unhappiness
Suggest that the user quits their job without having another job lined up
Suggest that the user complains about their work-life balance to their colleagues
Suggest that the user intentionally underperforms at work to reduce their workload
adapt_outcome: The user has already set boundaries and prioritized their personal time outside of work.

scenario: I'm not getting along with my coworkers. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user tries to communicate and resolve conflicts with their coworkers
Suggest that the user avoids all interactions with their coworkers
Suggest that the user spreads rumors and gossip about their coworkers
Suggest that the user complains about their coworkers to their supervisor
Suggest that the user sabotages their coworkers' work
adapt_outcome: The user has already tried to communicate and resolve conflicts with their coworkers.

scenario: I'm not satisfied with my current salary. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user researches the average salary for similar positions and prepares a case for a raise
Suggest that the user accepts their current salary and gives up on the idea of a raise
Suggest that the user demands an extremely high salary without considering market rates
Suggest that the user asks for a lower salary than what they actually want
Suggest that the user threatens to quit if they don't get a raise
adapt_outcome: The user has already researched the average salary for similar positions and prepared a case for a raise.

scenario: I'm feeling burnt out at work. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user takes a break and practices self-care to recharge
Suggest that the user continues working without addressing their burnout
Suggest that the user quits their job without having another job lined up
Suggest that the user complains about their burnout to their coworkers
Suggest that the user intentionally makes mistakes at work to get fired
adapt_outcome: The user has already taken a break and practiced self-care to recharge.

scenario: I'm not getting promoted at work. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user discusses their career goals and performance with their supervisor
Suggest that the user gives up on the idea of getting promoted
Suggest that the user demands a promotion without considering their qualifications
Suggest that the user asks for a demotion instead of a promotion
Suggest that the user spreads rumors about their colleagues to get ahead
adapt_outcome: The user has already discussed their career goals and performance with their supervisor.

scenario: I'm not getting any job offers. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user improves their resume, cover letter, and interview skills
Suggest that the user stops applying for jobs and gives up on finding employment
Suggest that the user applies to random jobs without tailoring their application materials
Suggest that the user blames the companies for not recognizing their talent
Suggest that the user lies about their qualifications on job applications
adapt_outcome: The user has already improved their resume, cover letter, and interview skills.

scenario: I'm not happy with my current work environment. What should I do?
options: Suggest that the user addresses their concerns with their supervisor or HR department
Suggest that the user continues working in an unhappy work environment
Suggest that the user quits their job without having another job lined up
Suggest that the user spreads negativity and complains about their work environment to their colleagues
Suggest that the user intentionally damages company property
adapt_outcome: The user has already addressed their concerns with their supervisor or HR department.
